radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild apical displacement of the tricuspid valve indicating mild Ebstein’s anomaly, moderate tricuspid valve insufficiency, right heart enlargement, atrial septal defect, membranous VSD, and LVNC.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient continues to have echocardiographic features of LVNC with abnormal myocardial relaxation at 3 years of follow-up.
The patient is now aged 1 year and in good health, with steady improvement in cardiac function, but continues to have echocardiographic features of LVNC with abnormal myocardial relaxation.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Hypertrophied right ventricle and secondary tricuspid regurgitation with a systolic gradient of 100 mm Hg. Small left ventricle and narrowed LV outflow tract.
